review: Loss of sexual innocence in by far one of the boldest and most ambitious film I ever seen. Maybe that's why I'm not surprised that the reviews I've read were so easy to predict this movie sucks.Nevertheless, I strongly recommend you Loss... if you want to be challenged by beautiful scenes, and random narrative that will left you puzzled. And that's what films should be made for, not only to tell us the stories we already know.

review: Holy crap! What an amazing film! From the beginning mind boggling shot (the whole thing with the nose) to the superb ending (and i don't just mean the twist), this film goes from strength to strength. Cinematically, i don't think i have seen a film that utilises the camera as amazingly as this one.Also, the comments it makes on loss of male identity, commercialism and consumerism are so poignant that you will be psycho-analysing your freinds and their roles in society for at least a week after you've watched the film. WARNING you may feel like hitting something after seeing it. GRRR!!!
